column12: VACUUM PUMP POWER PLANT
column13: The invention relates to a vacuum pump power plant for producing electrical energy, using as primary energy the energy from the electricity mains, comprising a motor-driven pump (1) that pumps water from the bottom part of a tank (7) to the top thereof, where the vacuum has been formed, using the motor-driven vacuum pump (3). The delivery of the motor-driven pump (1) is connected to the turbogenerator (2), creating a vacuum. A condenser (8) condenses the vapour produced inside the tank (7) for the recirculation of the water.
column15: GONZALEZ MARTIN DOMINGO

column12: STABLE PHARMACEUTICAL COMPOSITIONS WITH A FAST ONSET
column13: The present invention provides stable solid pharmaceutical composition comprising dexketoprofen trometamol which a fast onset. The pharmaceutical compositions are not limited to a specific crystalline form in order to have a fast onset. The pharmaceutical compositions have a faster bioavailability, compare to the ones obtained by simple mixture, even when the composition obtained by direct compression and the composition as herein disclosed has the same dissolution profile in vitro. The pharmaceutical compositions have a low content of total impurities originating from the decomposition of dexketoprofen trometamol.
column15: DOMINGO-GONZALEZ JOAQUIM

column12: TURBINE COMPRISING LENTICULAR DISKS
column13: The invention relates to a turbine such as a reaction turbine that can operate with a liquid or gas fluid. The runner of the turbine is provided with the following elements: the shaft (2), which operates normally in a vertical position, a coupling flange (1) being installed in the upper part and a hub (5) or supporting hub flange being installed in the lower part; at least one disk (3), which has a convex-planar-lens-type cross-section, and has three blades (6) in the upper part thereof that form angles of 120° and are coupled to the shaft (2) by means of a cotter; and aerodynamic profiles (4), the disks being reinforced on the periphery thereof by two aerodynamic profiles, separated by an angle of 180°. The calculation formula: P real = 1/2 η t ρ n S V 3 P real = useful power; η t = total yield; n = number of disks; S = swept area; V = speed of the fluid.
column15: GONZALEZ MARTIN DOMINGO

column12: FORCED EOLIAN METHOD FOR PRODUCING ELECTRICAL ENERGY
column13: The invention relates to a method relating to the technical sector of electrical power plants, more concretely to wind power plants or wind farms. The battery of motor-driven fans (1)(2) sucks air from the atmosphere and discharges into the duct that has a rectangular frusto-pyramidal shape (3), and the discharge region of the duct contains a turbine (4) connected to an electrical generator (5), the turbine evacuating into the atmosphere. By applying the power calculation formulae to diagrams n° 1 and 2, at the inlet and outlet of the conduit, and establishing the relationship, the following is obtained: P 2 = C pt /C pv S 2 1 /S 2 2 P 1 where P 2 = power at the outlet of the channel in KW, C pt = power coefficient of the turbine, C pv = power coefficient of the fans, S 2 1 = swept area at the inlet in m 2 , S 2 2 = swept area at the outlet in m 2 , P 1 = power at the inlet of the duct in KW. Said method enables hydrogen to be produced at cheaper prices than petroleum. CO 2 pollution is practically reduced to zero. Said method can be used in all sectors of the industry and especially in those wherein consumption is significant.
column15: GONZALEZ MARTIN DOMINGO

column12: HYDROELECTRIC PROCESS FOR ELECTRIC ENERGY PRODUCTION
column13: The invention relates to a process used in the technical field of electrical energy plants, specifically hydroelectric pumping stations. The motor pump assembly (1) aspirates water (fresh or salt) from the deposit (3) and discharges same into the V-shaped channel (2); a turbine (4) connected to an electric generator (5) is installed in the channel discharge. The turbine discharges the deposit (3). The power calculation formulas are applied to diagrams No. 1 and 2 at the channel inlet and outlet and establish the ratio P 2 = C pt /C pb S 2 1 S 2 2 P 1, where P 2 = Power at the channel outlet in KW, C pt = Coefficient of the power of the turbine, C pb = Coefficient of the power at the pumps, S 2 1 = Area swept at the inlet in m 2 , S 2 2 = Area swept at the outlet in m 2 , and P 1 = Power at the channel inlet in KW. This process makes it possible to obtain hydrogen at a lower price than petroleum. CO 2 pollution is reduced nearly to zero. The process can be used in all sectors of the industry, especially in those where consumption is significant.
column15: GONZALEZ MARTIN DOMINGO

column12: TANQUE GAS PROPANO PARA MOTOCICLETAS
column13: En resumen la invención se plantea solucionar los problemas de las técnicas anteriores en la utilización de dispositivos que almacenan Gas licuado de petróleo o gas propano (tanque de gas), los cuales en su diseño interfieren perjudicando varios factores como son: la seguridad de el conductor de la motocicleta, la estabilidad de la motocicleta alterando el centro de gravedad del mismo. Con la técnica actual que se ha desarrollado soluciona de manera eficaz todo los problemas planteados en la técnica anterior debido a sus características, en primer lugar a su diseño único en forma de “U” o de herradura alargada, esta misma característica que permite incorporar el tanque a la motocicleta de una manera discreta, adecuada y segura. Su segunda característica se basa en la versatilidad de los diferentes tipos de materiales que pueden ser utilizados para su fabricación tales como: hierro fibra de vidrio, fibra de carbono, plástico resistente y cualquier otro material que encaje el perfil de cualidades similares. La tercera característica es que en el diseño especifico de nuestro modelo permite hacer la entrega del combustible (Gas licuado de petróleo ó gas propano) en su estado de vapor y no en estado liquido como se encuentra almacenado. Con nuestro diseño damos la oportunidad de que el sector de los motociclistas el cual es un sector amplio y creciente en nuestro país pueda pasar a la utilización de un combustible mas limpio y económico como lo es el GLP (Gas licuado de petróleo ó gas propano) de manera adecuada, estética, ergonómica, funcional y sobre todo segura.
column15: ABUD MANUEL DOMINGO GONZALEZ

column12: PROTOCOLO ANTI-COLISION CON COMUNICACION UNIDIRECCIONAL.
column13: El objeto de la invención es un protocolo de comunicaciones unidireccionales por canal común con contienda por el medio en el que no existe canal de retorno para confirmación de recepción ni mecanismo de escucha del canal por parte de los emisores. Descripción: N emisores y M receptores comparten el canal. Los emisores envían tramas con información con intervalos de tiempo marcados por una variable aleatoria. Todos los receptores reciben el mensaje que es procesado por el receptor determinado. Cuando los mensajes se pierden no existe mecanismo de detección ni recuperación de ningún tipo. Aplicaciones: Aviso del paso del emisor por la cercanía de un receptor. Por ejemplo para el pago automático y sin parada de peaje de autopista. Aviso de perdida de recepción. Para asegurar que objetos o personas no se alejen más allá de una distancia determinada del receptor. Etiquetas sin contactos. Para alarmas antirrobo de mercancía y facturación automática en cajas registradoras.
column15: SANDOVAL GONZALEZ JUAN DOMINGO

column12: One-way communication anti-collusion protocol has common channel conflicting over the medium, in which there is no return channel for confirmation nor channel listening mechanism by the emitters
column13: One-way communications protocol via a common channel conflicting over the medium, in which there is no return channel for confirmation nor channel listening mechanism by the emitters, wherein N transmitters and M receivers share the channel. The transmitters send information frames at time intervals marked by a random variable. All receivers receive the message that is processed by the given receiver. When messages are lost, no detection or recovery mechanism whatsoever is available.
column15: SANDOVAL GONZALEZ JUAN DOMINGO

column12: ONE-WAY COMMUNICATION ANTICOLLISION PROTOCOL
column13: The invention refers to a one-way communications protocol via a common channel conflicting over the medium, in which there is no return channel for confirmation nor channel listening mechanism by the emitters, wherein N transmitters and M receivers share the channel. The transmitters send information frames at time intervals marked by a random variable. All receivers receive the message that is processed by the given receiver. When messages are lost, no detection or recovery mechanism whatsoever is available. The invention has the following applications: warns when the emitter passes near the receiver; automatic payment of highway tolls without having to stop; reception loss warning; ensuring that objects or persons do not go beyond a given distance pass the receiver; contactless labels; anti-theft alarms of merchandise and automatic billing in cash registers.
column15: SANDOVAL GONZALEZ JUAN DOMINGO

column12: Sistema de transporte para desplazamiento de pasajeros/mercancías
column13: Sistema de transporte para desplazamiento de pasajeros/mercancías que comprende: una pluralidad de eslabones de tracción (100) conectados entre sí mediante ejes-pasadores (4)perpendiculares a un sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D para formar una cadena de eslabones detracción (100); medios de accionamiento (400) para transmitir un movimiento de accionamiento desde al menos un motor(410); medios de arrastre (300, 320, 321, 310, 311) configurados para transmitir un movimiento de arrastre desdelos medios de accionamiento (400) hasta la cadena de eslabones de tracción (100); los eslabones de tracción(100) comprenden: una superficie funcional que tiene primeros medios de engranaje (130, 131); y los medios de arrastre comprenden segundos medios de engranaje (330, 331) que tienen una formaconjugada con los primeros medios de engranaje (130, 131), para que los eslabones de tracción (100) seanarrastrados por los medios de arrastre por medio de un engranaje entre los primeros medios de engranaje(130, 131) y los segundos medios de engranaje (330, 331) y arrastrar dicha cadena de eslabones de tracción(100) en el sentido de desplazamiento D los primeros medios de engranaje comprenden un arco cóncavo (130) perpendicular al sentido longitudinal dedesplazamiento D; los segundos medios de engranaje comprenden un rodillo de arrastre (330) perpendicular al sentidolongitudinal de desplazamiento D; para constituir un primer engranaje (130-330): en un sentido perpendicular al sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D; entre los medios de arrastre (300) y la cadena de eslabones de tracción (100) cuando el rodillo de arrastre(330) es alojado en el arco cóncavo (130), caracterizado porque los primeros medios de engranaje comprenden una pluralidad de protuberancias en forma de dientes (131)perpendiculares al sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D; los segundos medios de engranaje comprenden una pluralidad de alojamientos (331) perpendiculares alsentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D; para constituir un segundo engranaje (131-331): en un sentido perpendicular al sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D; entre los medios de arrastre (300) y la cadena de eslabones de tracción (100) cuando las protuberancias enforma de dientes (131) son alojadas en los alojamientos (331); cuando el rodillo de arrastre (330) es deformado en el primer engranaje (130-330) para evitar cargaselevadas sobre dicho rodillo (330).

column12: Cercha modular para escaleras mecánicas/pasillos rodantes y procedimiento de ensamblaje de una cercha modular para escaleras mecánicas/pasillos rodantes
column13: Cerchas modulares para escalera mecánica/pasillo rodante que comprenden un módulo superior (1), un módulo central (2) y un módulo inferior (3), cada módulo (1, 2, 3) comprende - un primer lado (4) y un segundo lado (5) opuestos al primer lado (4), cada lado (4, 5) de los módulos (1, 2, 3) a su vez comprende un perfil inferior (6) y un perfil superior (7), y - una placa de plafón (8) colocada entre ambos lados (4, 5), - en la que los módulos (1, 2, 3) comprenden - una pluralidad de vigas verticales situadas entre el perfil inferior (6) y el perfil superior (7) de cada lado (4, 5), dichas vigas verticales son soportes verticales de guía (9) configurados para soportar y posicionar el sistema de guiado de la escalera mecánica/pasillo rodante, - una pluralidad de vigas diagonales (10) entre el perfil inferior (6) y el perfil superior (7) de cada lado (4, 5), - y una pluralidad de travesaños (11) entre ambos lados (4, 5), cada travesaño (11) está colocado entre un par de soportes verticales de guía opuestos (9), - en la que los perfiles inferiores (6) son un soporte directo para un revestimiento exterior (15) de la escalera mecánica/pasillo rodante, CARACTERIZADAS PORQUE - cada uno de los perfiles inferiores (6) incluye varias protuberancias en ambos lados para permitir las conexiones, - en la que los perfiles superiores (7) son un soporte directo para las barandillas (12) y los perfiles de la cubierta exterior (13) de la escalera mecánica/pasillo rodante, - cada uno de los perfiles superiores (7) tiene dos partes diferenciadas, que son una parte superior y una parte inferior, - en la que la parte superior es más ancha que la parte inferior, - en la que la parte inferior es una parte abierta que está directamente conectada a las vigas verticales y a las diagonales (10) con varias protuberancias para permitir las conexiones, y - en la que la parte superior incluye una pluralidad de formas para conectar el perfil de cubierta exterior (13) en un lado exterior y la barandilla (12) en un lado interior.

column12: Escalator/moving Walk Modular Truss And Method For Assembling Same
column13: The present invention discloses an escalator/moving walk modular truss and a method for assembling the same. Each module 1, 2, 3 comprises the relative side parts 4, vertical beam 9 and inclined beam 10. The side part comprises a lower forming component 6 and an upper forming component 7, the vertical beam 9 and the inclined beam 10 are placed between the lower forming component 6 and the upper forming component 7. The lower forming component 6 is used to directly support an outer coverage layer of an escalator/moving walk, and the upper forming component 7 directly supports the handrail 12 and an outer laid plate forming member 13 of the escalator/moving walk. In addition, the method for assembling the escalator/moving walk modular truss comprises cold rolling the forming components 6, 7, and cold connecting the vertical beam 9 and the inclined beam 10 between the forming components 6, 7.
column15: GONZALEZ PANTIGA JUAN DOMINGO;;MORAN GARCIA EDUARD

column12: INDUSTRIAL-SCALE WIND-ENERGY-COLLECTION SYSTEM WHICH CAN BE INSTALLED IN THE SEA
column13: The invention relates to an industrail-scale wind-energy-collection system which can be installed in the sea. The inventive system comprises a main shaft (1) which is raised at the ends by two supports (S). According to the invention, several rigs extend from the aforemetioned shaft, each of said rigs comprising a pair of parallel masts (8) which are connected at the ends thereof by means of a fixing bar or crossbar (5). The resulting parallelogram in each forms the sail surface which is divided into various different sails (6), each being supported by a shaft (7) that can rotate through 90 °.

column12: CONVEYOR SYSTEM FOR PASSENGER/ARTICLE TRANSPORTATION
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a portable type movable passage system by reducing the cost of a conveyor system and eliminating the necessity of extensive civil engineering construction work to make a depression.

SOLUTION: This is related to a pallet working system to move a pallet on a passage moving through a driving chain 300 directly engaged with a lower part of a chain of traction links 100. The driving chain has an individual driving roller 330 made of a deformable elastic material. The links of the traction chain are connected to one another by connecting shafts, and each of them has a tooth and a click on a lower part so as to be engaged with the driving chain and the roller.

column12: CARRO PARA ARRASTRE DE PASAMANOS DE PASILLOS Y ESCALERAS MOVILES.
column13: Carro para arrastre de pasamanos de pasillos y escaleras móviles, que comprende un cuerpo (6) en forma de placa vertical en el que van montados rodillos conductores (7) de eje horizontal para apoyo sobre una guía (5) que discurre próxima al pasamanos (1), por dentro del mismo; medios de enclavamiento con una cadena de arrastre (2) para el pasamanos; una rueda (24) de giro libre destinada a apoyar contra un perfil de leva (25) de la guía para desplazar los medios de enclavamiento desde una posición operativa, en la cual fija el carro (4) a la cadena (2), y una posición inoperante, en la cual liberan al carro de dicha cadena; y un brazo (8) que sobresale horizontalmente de la placa para engranar con husillos de paso variable, caracterizado porque los medios de enclavamiento citados están constituidos por dos trinquetes (12-13) y por dos palancas (15-16) de accionamiento de dichos trinquetes; cuyos trinquetes van articulados al cuerpo (6) del carro según primeros ejes (14) horizontales, alrededor de los cuales pueden bascular entre una posición vertical operativa, en la cual sobresalen superiormente del cuerpo para introducirse entre dos roldanas (29) consecutivas de la cadena (2) de arrastre, y una posición horizontal inoperante, en la cual quedan en alineación y definen superiormente una pista de apoyo para dichas roldanas; y cuyas, palancas (15-16) de accionamiento van articuladas entre sí por un punto intermedio mediante un segundo eje (17) horizontal que está montado en el cuerpo del carro mediante una corredera vertical, situada por debajo de los puntos de articulación de los. trinquetes al carro, por la que puede desplazarse verticalmente, mientras que por el extremo superior cada palanca (15-16) va articulada a un trinquete (12-13) mediante terceros ejes (23) paralelos y simétricos que quedan situados, en la posición inoperante de los trinquetes, por dentro y por debajo de los primeros ejes (14) de articulación de dichos trinquetes con el cuerpo del carro, y en la posición operativa, por dentro y por encima de los citados puntos de articulación de los trinquetes; siendo al menos una de las palancas (16) portadora en su extremo inferior de la rueda (24) de giro libre que apoyará contra el perfil de leva (25) citado, para desplazar verticalmente al segundo eje (17) de articulación de dichas palancas en la corredera vertical citada entre posiciones límite superior e inferior, que se corresponden con las posiciones operativa e inoperante de los trinquetes, llevando además las palancas montadas entre sus extremos inferiores un resorte (26) de compresión que se mantiene en tensión cualquiera que sea la posición de dichas palancas.

column12: PASAMANOS DE VELOCIDAD VARIABLE PARA SISTEMAS TRANSPORTADORES DE PERSONAS.
column13: Pasamanos de velocidad variable para sistemas transportadores de personas, que comprende un perfil flexible que circula a lo largo del pasillo o escalera, con un tramo de ida y un tramo de retorno, un mecanismo de arrastre de dicho perfil, y un sin fin de asideros acoplados sobre el perfil flexible, caracterizado porque el perfil flexible citado se mueve con velocidad constante en todo su recorrido y los asideros son independientes de dicho perfil y se mueven con velocidad sensiblemente igual a la de las placas transportadoras más próximas; disponiendo dichos asideros para su arrastre de primeros y segundos medios de conexión a un mecanismo de arrastre a velocidad constante y a un mecanismo auxiliar de arrastre a velocidad variable, respectivamente; cuyos primeros medios de conexión conectan el asidero con el mecanismo de arrastre a velocidad constante cuando dicho asidero se desplaza a lo largo del trayecto en el que las placas transportadoras se mueven a velocidad constante, mientras que los segundos medios de conexión conectan el asidero al mecanismo auxiliar de arrastre o velocidad variable cuando dichos asideros se desplazan a lo largo del trayecto en el que las placas transportadoras se mueven a velocidad variable.

column12: CARRIAGE FOR DRIVING HANDRAIL OF WALKWAY AND MOVING STAIR
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a carriage for driving grips of variable-speed handrails of moving walkways and moving stairs, for operating a section between a terminal section for low-speed operation and an intermediate portion for high-speed operation at variable speed.

SOLUTION: The carriage comprises a body 6 in the form of a vertical plate in which leading rollers 7 are mounted; two swinging locking pawls 12, 13 for locking with a drive chain; a free turning wheel 24 supported against a cam profile in order to cause the pawls 12, 13 to swing between an operative vertical position and an inoperative horizontal position; and an arm 8 engaged with variable pitch screws. Thus, auxiliary components can be eliminated and operational problems can be prevented.

column12: Drive system for movable platforms
column13: The present invention relates to a drive system for movable platforms (2, 3) having a bearing structure (1), independent movement subsystems (4, 5, 10, 11) having a drive chain (4) for being guided between chain guides (7) along a trajectory, a lifting subsystem (5) in the loading area and a lifting subsystem (5') in the unloading area for moving movable platforms (2, 3), a plurality of linear motors (10) for horizontally moving the movable platforms (2, 3), platforms (2, 3) having horizontal movement devices having front rollers (61'), rear rollers (62'), drive devices having a plurality of connectors (8) and drive equipment (12, 13) for moving the drive chain (4) according to a reversible, point-to-point, discontinuous movement.

column12: Accessible transport system for moving pasengers and/or goods
column13: The present invention relates to an accessible transport system for moving passengers/goods having a movable platform (3, 3', 3") having a floor (1) configured for supporting a weight of the passengers/goods during a transport path and side walls (100) attached in the lower area to the floor (1), the floor (1) and the side walls (100) forming a U-shaped cross-section, wherein the side walls (100) of the movable platform (3, 3', 3") have a structure for reducing pit depth and reaching a stacking grade in the transport system such that the height of two stacked platforms is less that the sum of the height of the two platforms and greater than the height of one platform, wherein movable platforms on a transport path (3') cross paths with movable platforms on a return path (3").

column12: EXTERNAL SIGNATURE DEVICE FOR A PC WITH OPTICAL DATA INPUT VIA THE MONITOR
column13: The invention relates to a device for electronic signature of data that can be immediately used in electronic banking and electronic commerce or in any other system based on electronic signature. The device has an electronic data input and the data can be received via any computer screen, in addition to a display to show the data to be signed. The device is not reprogrammable, which makes it immune to possible attacks by virus or malicious software that could affect the security of the system. Furthermore, the display of data to be signed makes it possible for the user to know what data he or she is actually signing.

column12: Method for operating a brushed direct current electric motor
column13: A method for operating a brushed direct current electric motor may include receiving an input signal, determining an output duty cycle depending on the received input signal, determining an output frequency depending on the determined output duty cycle, generating a pulse width modulated output signal with the determined output duty cycle and the determined output frequency, and driving the brushed direct current electric motor via the generated pulse width modulated output signal. The input signal may indicate at least one of (i) a requested rotational speed of the brushed direct current electric motor and (ii) a requested output motor voltage to drive the brushed direct current electric motor.
column15: CARRION JUAN;;DOMINGO CARLOS;;GASEO JORGE;;GONZALEZ ESPIN FRANCISCO

The input signal may indicate at least one of (i) a requested rotational speed of the brushed direct current electric motor and (ii) a requested output motor voltage to drive the brushed direct current electric motor.

column13: Small stool for gluteo-lumbar support for seating the odontologist (dentist, dental surgeon) and auxiliary staff. column12: SAFETY DEVICE FOR MOVING HANDRAILS
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for moving handrails consisting of a stop ( 5 ), arranged at the entrance of the handrail ( 1 ) assembled on a fixed railing ( 3 ) finishing the handrail, the stop ( 5 ) being connected to a rod ( 7 ) which can move longitudinally and is retractable against a spring ( 9 ), the device comprising a hinged outer lid ( 15 ) having locking pawls ( 19 ) for an inner lid ( 18 ), such that the outer lid ( 15 ) automatically tends to the open position due to the effect of the springs ( 17 ) affecting the hinge ( 16 ) when the stop ( 5 ) is retracted and the locking means ( 10 ) of the latter are released, whereas the inner lid ( 18 ), upon being released, also tends to the open position by simple gravity. In this way when a user does not let go of the handrail ( 1 ) when it penetrates the railing ( 3 ), he or she drives the stop ( 5 ) with his or her hand and the lids ( 15 ) and ( 18 ) are automatically opened, preventing injury to the hand of the user and causing the stop of the handrail through a microswitch ( 23 ).

column12: MOVING WALKWAY
column13: The invention relates to a moving walkway transporting people on a grooved surface included in pallets ( 1 ) having the same pitch as the traction chain, all of them being able to be attached by means of pins ( 2 ) forming the actual traction chain between them, in which the pallets ( 1 ) are overturned by means of a guide ( 3 ) in which only three pallets are located, causing a quick overturning allowing the comb ( 5 ) to have sufficient inertia in its ribs ( 6 ) so as to support the loads which the users will apply to it in the direction ( 4 ).

column12: TURNAROUND CURVE SYSTEM FOR A CHAIN CONVEYOR SYSTEM
column13: The invention relates to a turnaround curve system for a chain conveyor system, having a chain having linear traction which is driven in turnaround sections by means of turnaround guides ( 7 ). The turnaround guides ( 7 ) have a geometry obtained by means of a family of curves corresponding to paths defined by six points ( 1 - 6 ), the six points ( 1 - 6 ) corresponding to six linkage positions of consecutive links of the chain in the turnaround sections. The system allows the turnaround sections to be more compact and extend the life of the rollers of the chain, since the rollers are subjected to smaller loads.

column12: SISTEMA DE CURVA DE VOLTEO PARA SISTEMA DE TRANSPORTE POR CADENA
column13: Sistema de curva de volteo para sistema de transporte por cadena que tiene una cadena que tiene tracción lineal que está conducida en tramos de volteo mediante guías (7) de volteo. Las guías (7) de volteo tienen una geometría obtenida mediante una familia de curvas que corresponden con trayectorias definidas por seis puntos (1-6), correspondiendo los seis puntos (1-6) con seis posiciones de articulaciones de eslabones consecutivos de la cadena en los tramos de volteo. El sistema permite que los tramos de volteo sean más compactos y alarga la vida de los rodillos de la cadena, pues las cargas a las que los rodillos son sometidos son menores.

column12: LONGITUDINAL CONNECTION PART
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a longitudinal connection part which is usable as a passage between a first passage surface and a second passage surface that are adjacent to one another and usable as a pedestrian passage, and is capable of varying a distance in a longitudinal direction between the first passage surface and the second passage surface.SOLUTION: The longitudinal connection part includes a plurality of transverse slats 4 which have a substantially planar upper surface and are attached to one another, each of the transverse slats 4 is attached to the adjacent slat 4 by a pivot part and is made rotatable by the pivot part, and continuity of an upper surface of a longitudinal connection member 1 is maintained. The transverse slat 4 is supported by a support curved surface, a first support surface and a second support surface, and some of the transverse slats 4 are hidden under a first passage surface 2 by relative rotation of the transverse slats 4 to one another by the pivot part according to a distance between the first passage surface 2 and a second passage surface 3 below the upper surface.

column12: Safety device for transport systems
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for transport systems comprising walkways and stairs by means of moving elements (1, 2) with longitudinal movements in which there is the possibility that said moving elements (1, 2) undergo tilting movements in relation to an operating direction. A safety counter-guide (7) is arranged on the moving elements (1, 2), preventing the upwards tilting of the moving elements (1, 2) and further having a lower sensor (8) in the form of a band that generates a stop signal for the system upon coming into with moving elements (1, 2). Therefore the moving elements (1, 2) cannot tilt in an upwards direction, preventing possible risks both for the user and for the mechanical system, and due to a possible tendency to said tilting caused by any anomaly, the system is automatically stopped.

column12: Longitudinal joint
column13: The present invention relates to a longitudinal joint of the type forming a surface usable as a passage between first and second passage surfaces (2,3) adjacent to one another, usable as walking user passage, the distance between both in the longitudinal direction being variable. The longitudinal joint (1) has transverse slats (4) attached to one another, with a substantially planar upper surface (5), each being attached to the contiguous slats by a pivot point (6) with respect to which they can rotate preserving the continuity of the surface of the longitudinal joint (1). The slats (4) rest on a series of support surfaces (8,9,12), a certain number of slats being hidden under the first passage surface (2), below the level of the upper surface (5), by means of the relative rotation to one another with respect to the pivot point (6), defending on the distance between first and second passage surfaces (2,3).
column15: GONZALEZ ALEMANY MIGUEL ANGEL;;DIAZ SORRIBAS MONICA;;PELLO GARCIA ALBERTO;;GONZALEZ PANTIGA JUAN DOMINGO

column12: DISPOSITIVO DE SEGURIDAD PARA PASAMANOS MOVILES
column13: Dispositivo de seguridad para pasamanos móviles que consiste en un tope (5), dispuesto a la entrada del pasamanos (1) montado en una balaustrada fija (3) que remata el pasamanos, estando el tope (5) conectado a una varilla (7) desplazable longitudinalmente y retráctil en contra de un muelle (9), comprendiendo el dispositivo una tapa exterior (15) y abisagrada que cuenta con gatillos de bloqueo (19) para una tapa interior (18), de manera que la tapa exterior (15) tiende automáticamente a la situación de apertura por efecto de muelles (17) que afectan a su bisagra (16) cuando el tope (5) se retrae y se liberan los medios de enclavamiento (10) de la misma, mientras que la tapa interior (18), al ser liberada, tiende también a la situación de apertura por simple gravedad. De esta manera cuando un usuario no suelta el pasamanos (1) cuando éste penetra en la balaustrada (3), arrastra con su mano al tope (5) y se produce la apertura automática de las tapas (15) y (18), evitando daños en la mano delusuario y provocando la parada del pasamanos a través de un microrruptor (23).
column14: THYSSENKRUPP NORTE SA;;THYSSENKRUP ELEVVATOR ES PBB L
column15: GONZALEZ ALEMANY MIGUEL ANGEL;;GONZALEZ PANTIGA JUAN DOMINGO;;ALONSO CUELLO MANUEL;;MENDIOLAGOITIA JULIANA JOSE

column12: Turnaround curve system for a chain conveyor system
column13: The invention relates to a turnaround curve system for a chain conveyor system, having a chain having linear traction which is driven in turnaround sections by means of turnaround guides (7). The turnaround guides (7) have a geometry obtained by means of a family of curves corresponding to paths defined by six points (1-6), the six points (1-6) corresponding to six linkage positions of consecutive links of the chain in the turnaround sections. The system allows the turnaround sections to be more compact and extend the life of the rollers of the chain, since the rollers are subjected to smaller loads.

column12: DISPOSITIVO DE SEGURIDAD PARA PASAMANOS MOVILES.
column13: Dispositivo de seguridad para pasamanos móviles como los utilizados en sistemas de transporte que comprenden pasillos y escaleras mecánicas, donde dicho pasamanos, en un extremo de salida del pasamanos, penetra en un interior de una balaustrada (3) hueca y fija, cuyo dispositivo comprende: una embocadura (4) de acceso al interior de la balaustrada (3); un tope (5): en correspondencia con la embocadura (4); retráctil en contra de la tensión de un resorte (9); una varilla longitudinal (7) solidaria al tope (5); una tapa exterior (15) montada sobre la parte fija de la balaustrada (3) lateralmente abatible con respecto a la misma entre una posición abierta y una posición cerrada; una tapa interior (18) montada sobre la parte fija de la balaustrada (3) lateralmente abatible con respecto a la misma entre una posición abierta y una posición cerrada, conectada con la tapa exterior (15) para que la apertura de la tapa interior (18) y de la tapa exterior (15) sea conjunta; donde: la varilla longitudinal (7) y el tope (5) están asociados, con posibilidad de desplazamiento longitudinal, a la tapa exterior (15), comprendiendo dicha varilla longitudinal (7) medios de bloqueo para la citada tapa (15) en posición cerrada. caracterizado porque, porque la tapa exterior (15) comprende una estructura móvil desplazable con la varilla (7), a la que son solidarios una pareja de gatillos (19) que bloquean la tapa interior (18) la cual dispone de una armadura interior (20), contando la tapa interior (18) a su vez con ruedas interiores (22) asociadas a la citada armadura (20) que deslizan sobre guías (21), solidarias a la balaustrada (3), cuyas guías (21) tiene forma de arco circular y un recorrido tal que permiten la apertura de la citada tapa interior (18) por gravedad, desplazándose verticalmente la tapa con respecto a la balaustrada (3) siguiendo el recorrido de las guías (21), quedando la citada tapa interior (18) escamoteada en el interior de la citada balaustrada (3) en la posición de apertura del dispositivo.

column12: SAFETY DEVICE FOR TRANSPORT SYSTEMS
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for transport systems comprising walkways and stairs by means of moving elements ( 1, 2 ) with longitudinal movements in which there is the possibility that said moving elements ( 1, 2 ) undergo tilting movements in relation to an operating direction. A safety counter-guide ( 7 ) is arranged on the moving elements ( 1, 2 ), preventing the upwards tilting of the moving elements ( 1, 2 ) and further having a lower sensor ( 8 ) in the form of a band that generates a stop signal for the system upon coming into with moving elements ( 1, 2 ). Therefore the moving elements ( 1, 2 ) cannot tilt in an upwards direction, preventing possible risks both for the user and for the mechanical system, and due to a possible tendency to said tilting caused by any anomaly, the system is automatically stopped.
column14: THYSSENKRUPP NORTE SA;;THYSSENKRUPP ELEVATOR ES PBB

column12: TRANSPORT SYSTEM FOR THE MOVEMENT OF PASSENGERS/GOODS
column13: The invention relates to a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by a moving endless belt having: a series of pallet assemblies ( 100, 101 ); drive equipment ( 300, 320, 321, 310, 311 ) for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment ( 400 ) to the pallet belt ( 100, 101 ) in a low speed section located in an embarking/disembarking area of the endless belt; drive equipment ( 300′, 310′, 311 ′) for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment ( 400 ′) to the pallet belt ( 100, 101 ) in a high speed section located in a middle area of the endless belt; drive equipment ( 300 ″) for transmitting a drive movement from actuation equipment ( 400 ″) to the pallet belt ( 100, 101 ) in a transitional speed section located between the embarking/disembarking area and the middle area of the endless belt.

column12: Pallet assembly for a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods
column13: The invention relates to a pallet assembly ( 100, 101 ) for a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by a moving endless belt based on said pallet assemblies ( 100, 101 ). Each assembly has: a driven pallet ( 101 ) which is driven by a drive pallet ( 100 ), both pallets ( 100, 101 ) being hinged to one another according to an axis perpendicular to a movement direction D of the belt. The pallets ( 100, 101 ) have a rocking beam ( 13 ) having: an end hinged to a functional surface according to an axis perpendicular to the movement direction D; another end having: at least one concave arc ( 130 ) perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction D in the form of a claw; to form a meshing: in a direction perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction D; between drive equipment ( 300, 300 ′) and the drive pallet ( 100 ) through the concave arc ( 130 ).

column12: Safety device for moving handrails
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for moving handrails consisting of a stop (5), arranged at the entrance of the handrail (1) assembled on a fixed railing (3) finishing the handrail, the stop (5) being connected to a rod (7) which can move longitudinally and is retractable against a spring (9), the device comprising a hinged outer lid (15) having locking pawls (19) for an inner lid (18), such that the outer lid (15) automatically tends to the open position due to the effect of the springs (17) affecting the hinge (16) when the stop (5) is retracted and the locking means (10) of the latter are released, whereas the inner lid (18), upon being released, also tends to the open position by simple gravity. In this way when a user does not let go of the handrail (1) when it penetrates the railing (3), he or she drives the stop (5) with his or her hand and the lids (15) and (18) are automatically opened, preventing injury to the hand of the user and causing the stop of the handrail through a microswitch (23).

column13: The invention relates to a moving walkway formed by a series of pallets ( 1 ) with a rectangular contour having a passable surface and connected with drive means. column12: SAFETY DEVICE FOR TRANSPORT SYSTEM
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a safety device for a transport system capable of tilting movement with respect to an operating direction and including walkways and stairs moving in a longitudinal direction by means of moving elements.

SOLUTION: A safety counter-guide 7 is arranged on the moving elements 1, 2, preventing the upwards tilting of the moving elements 1, 2 and further having a lower sensor 8 in the form of a band that generates a stop signal for the system upon coming into with moving elements 1, 2. Therefore the moving elements 1, 2 cannot tilt in an upwards direction, preventing possible risks both for the user and for the mechanical system, and due to a possible tendency to the tilting caused by any anomaly, the system is automatically stopped.

column12: Moving walkway
column13: The travelator comprises pallet with grooves, axles, haulage chain, guide, comb, where the pallets are equal to steps of haulage chain. The steps of haulage chain are combined by axles forming a haulage chain. The pallets are rotated by the guide.

column12: Moving walkway
column13: The invention relates to a moving walkway formed by a series of pallets (1) with a rectangular contour having a passable surface and connected with drive means. The pallets are consecutively connected to one another along the end sections of their adjacent parallel edges, by means of connection devices defining hinges with a pin perpendicular to the direction of movement of the pallets, and have between said sections means defining, in the forward movement path of the walkway, mutual supports between coplanar consecutive pallets.

column12: Moving walkway
column13: The invention relates to a moving walkway transporting people on a grooved surface included in pallets (1) having the same pitch as the traction chain, all of them being able to be attached by means of pins (2) forming the actual traction chain between them, in which the pallets (1) are overturned by means of a guide (3) in which only three pallets are located, causing a quick overturning allowing the comb (5) to have sufficient inertia in its ribs (6) so as to support the loads which the users will apply to it in the direction (4).

column12: Longitudinal joint
column13: The present invention relates to a longitudinal joint of the type forming a surface usable as a passage between first and second passage surfaces (2,3) adjacent to one another, usable as walking user passage, the distance between both in the longitudinal direction being variable. The longitudinal joint (1) has transverse slats (4) attached to one another, with a substantially planar upper surface (5), each being attached to the contiguous slats by a pivot point (6) with respect to which they can rotate preserving the continuity of the surface of the longitudinal joint (1). The slats (4) rest on a series of support surfaces (8,9,12), a certain number of slats being hidden under the first passage surface (2), below the level of the upper surface (5), by means of the relative rotation to one another with respect to the pivot point (6), defending on the distance between first and second passage surfaces (2,3).

column12: SAFETY DEVICE FOR MOVING HANDRAIL
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a safety device in the case where a user does not take off his/her hand from a moving handrail in the region where the handrail approaches a railing.

SOLUTION: The safety device for moving handrails is provided with a stopper 5 assembled on the fixed railing where the handrail 1 ends and arranged at the entrance of the handrail 1. The stopper 5 is connected to a rod 7 movable longitudinally and retractable against a spring 9. The device comprises a hinged outer lid 15 having locking pawls 19 for an inner lid. The outer lid 15 automatically moves to the open position due to spring effects affecting a hinge when the stopper 5 is retracted and a locking means 10 of the outer lid 15 is released, whereas the inner lid, upon being released, also moves to the open position by simple gravity. Thus, in the case where a user does not take off his/her hand from the handrail 1 when it penetrates the railing, he/she drives the stopper 5 with his/her hand and the lid 15 is automatically opened, preventing injury to the hand of the user and causing the stop of the handrail 1 through a microswitch.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2008,JPO&INPIT

column12: PALLET ASSEMBLY FOR TRANSPORT SYSTEM FOR MOVEMENT OF PASSENGER/GOODS
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by moving an endless belt based on pallet assemblies, in regard to the pallet assemblies.

SOLUTION: Each assembly has a driven pallet 101 driven by a drive pallet 100, and both the pallets 100, 101 are hinged to one another along an axis perpendicular to a movement direction of the belt. Both the pallets 100, 101 have a rocking beam 13 provided with one end hinged to a functional surface along an axis perpendicular to the movement direction and with the other end having at least one concave arc 130 perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction in the form of a claw, and form a meshing in a direction perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction between drive equipment 300, 300'' and the drive pallet 100 through the concave arc 130.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2008,JPO&INPIT

column12: CONJUNTO DE PALETAS PARA UN SISTEMA DE TRANSPORTE PARA DESPLAZAMIENTO DE PASAJEROS/MERCANCIAS.
column13: Un conjunto de paletas (100, 101) para un sistema de transporte para desplazamiento de pasajeros/mercancías constituido por una banda sinfín desplazable a base de dichos conjuntos de paletas (100, 101) donde cada conjunto: tiene una superficie de apoyo (160) configurada para soportar un pasajero/mercancía; comprende una paleta arrastrada (101) que es arrastrada por una paleta de arrastre (100), estando ambas paletas (100, 101) articuladas entre sí según un eje perpendicular a una dirección de desplazamiento D de la banda; en donde: las paletas (100, 101) comprenden: una superficie funcional opuesta a la superficie de apoyo (160) y que tiene primeros medios de engranaje (130, 131); los primeros medios de engranaje (130, 131) comprenden un balancín (13) que tiene: un primer extremo articulado a la superficie funcional según un eje perpendicular a la dirección de desplazamiento D; un segundo extremo opuesto al primer extremo que tiene: al menos un arco cóncavo (130) perpendicular al sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D en forma de uña; para constituir un primer/segundo engranaje: en un sentido perpendicular al sentido longitudinal de desplazamiento D; entre primeros medios de arrastre (300)/segundos medios de arrastre (300') y la paleta de arrastre (100) a través del arco cóncavo (130); caracterizado porque: el segundo extremo del balancín (13) consta de un rodillo de arrastre (131) perpendicular a la dirección del movimiento longitudinal D; para formar un tercer engranaje: en una dirección perpendicular a la dirección del movimiento longitudinal D; entre terceros medios de arrastre (300'') y la paleta de arrastre (100) a través del rodillo de arrastre (131).

column12: SISTEMA DE CURVA DE VOLTEO PARA SISTEMA DE TRANSPORTE POR CADENA.
column13: Sistema de curva de volteo para sistema de transporte por cadena, que comprende una cadena que tiene tracción lineal que está conducida en tramos de volteo mediante guías (7) de volteo, teniendo dichas guías (7) de volteo una geometría obtenida mediante una familia de curvas que corresponden con trayectorias definidas por seis puntos (1-6), correspondiendo dichos seis puntos (1-6) con seis posiciones de articulaciones de eslabones consecutivos de la cadena en los tramos de volteo, tales que: la primera trayectoria (1-2) entre el primer punto (1) y el segundo punto (2) y la quinta trayectoria (5-6) entre el quinto punto (5) y el sexto punto (6) definen una velocidad lineal, constante y paralela a un tramo recto del sistema de transporte entre los tramos de volteo; la segunda trayectoria y la cuarta trayectoria tienen una geometría determinada; y la tercera trayectoria está determinada por la posición de las articulaciones primera, segunda, cuarta y quinta para conservar una distancia entre eslabones; caracterizado porque al pasar cada articulación a una posición ocupada por la siguiente articulación en un intervalo de tiempo "t", las trayectorias quedan definidas por seis puntos determinados por las siguientes ecuaciones: X1= -P; Y1= H/2; X2= 0; Y2= H/2; X3= P*cos(b); Y3= P/2; X4= P*cos(b); Y4= -P/2; X5= 0; Y5= -H/2; X6= -P; Y6= -H/2; siendo: P: valor del paso de la cadena; H: distancia entre un primer ramal y un segundo ramal de la cadena; b= asen((H/2-P/2)/P); y estando las curvas de las trayectorias definidas por las siguientes ecuaciones: 1-2: X1(t)=-P+P*t; Y1(t)=H/2; 2-3≡f1(D): (X2-X1)^2+(Y2-Y1)^2=P^2; X2/(Y2+D)=tan(a)*t; siendo a= atan(P*cos(b)/(P/2+D)); 3-4: (X3-X2)^2+(Y3-Y2)^2=P^2; (X3-X4)^2+(Y3-Y4)^2=P^2; 4-5: t'=1-t X4(t')=X2(t); Y4(t')=-Y2(t); 5-6: X5(t)=-P*t; Y5(t)=-H/2; asignando a "t" un valor comprendido entre 0 y 1 y siendo D un parámetro con valor óptimo cuando se cumple la siguiente condición: dX2/dY2(t=1) = dX3/dY3(t=0) dX3/dY3(t=1) = dX4/dY4(t=0) la geometría de la guía está definida por la trayectoria de rodadura del rodillo (8) cuando las articulaciones siguen las trayectorias definidas.

column12: LONGITUDINAL JOINT
column13: PURPOSE: A longitudinal joint can provide a continued surface on which the users of elevators or moving walks can put their feet by forming the longitudinal joint between two fixed pit covers without any other tools manually or mechanically operated. CONSTITUTION: A longitudinal joint(1) comprises multiple transverse slats(4) attached to each other. The transverse slats are attached to each other at a turning point. The transverse slats rotate on the turning point to maintain the continued surface of the longitudinal joint. The longitudinal joint comprises a first intermediate surface attached to a first path surface(2) and a second intermediate surface attached to a second path surface(3).

column12: Safety device for transport systems
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for transport systems comprising walkways and stairs by means of moving elements (1, 2) with longitudinal movements in which there is the possibility that said moving elements (1, 2) undergo tilting movements in relation to an operating direction. A safety counter-guide (7) is arranged on the moving elements (1, 2), preventing the upwards tilting of the moving elements (1, 2) and further having a lower sensor (8) in the form of a band that generates a stop signal for the system upon coming into with moving elements (1, 2). Therefore the moving elements (1, 2) cannot tilt in an upwards direction, preventing possible risks both for the user and for the mechanical system, and due to a possible tendency to said tilting caused by any anomaly, the system is automatically stopped.

column12: Pallet assembly for a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods
column13: The invention relates to a pallet assembly (100, 101) for a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by a moving endless belt based on said pallet assemblies (100, 101). Each assembly has: a driven pallet (101) which is driven by a drive pallet (100), both pallets (100, 101) being hinged to one another according to an axis perpendicular to a movement direction D of the belt. The pallets (100, 101) have a rocking beam (13) having: an end hinged to a functional surface according to an axis perpendicular to the movement direction D another end having: at least one concave arc (130) perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction D in the form of a claw to form a meshing: in a direction perpendicular to the longitudinal movement direction D between drive equipment (300, 300') and the drive pallet (100) through the concave arc (130).

column12: Turnaround curve system for a chain conveyor system
column13: The invention relates to a turnaround curve system for a chain conveyor system, having a chain having linear traction which is driven in turnaround sections by means of turnaround guides (7). The turnaround guides (7) have a geometry obtained by means of a family of curves corresponding to paths defined by six points (1-6), the six points (1-6) corresponding to six linkage positions of consecutive links of the chain in the turnaround sections. The system allows the turnaround sections to be more compact and extend the life of the rollers of the chain, since the rollers are subjected to smaller loads.

column12: Safety device for moving handrails
column13: The invention relates to a safety device for moving handrails consisting of a stop (5), arranged at the entrance of the handrail (1) assembled on a fixed railing (3) finishing the handrail, the stop (5) being connected to a rod (7) which can move longitudinally and is retractable against a spring (9), the device comprising a hinged outer lid (15) having locking pawls (19) for an inner lid (18), such that the outer lid (15) automatically tends to the open position due to the effect of the springs (17) affecting the hinge (16) when the stop (5) is retracted and the locking means (10) of the latter are released, whereas the inner lid (18), upon being released, also tends to the open position by simple gravity. In this way when a user does not let go of the handrail (1) when it penetrates the railing (3), he or she drives the stop (5) with his or her hand and the lids (15) and (18) are automatically opened, preventing injury to the hand of the user and causing the stop of the handrail through a microswitch (23).

column13: The invention relates to a safety device for moving handrails consisting of a stop (5), arranged at the entrance of the handrail (1) assembled on a fixed railing (3) finishing the handrail, the stop (5) being connected to a rod (7) which can move longitudinally and is retractable against a spring (9), the device comprising a hinged outer lid (15) having locking pawls (19) for an inner lid (18), such that the outer lid (15) automatically tends to the open position due to the effect of the springs (17) affecting the hinge (16) when the stop (5) is retracted and the locking means (10) of the latter are released, whereas the inner lid (18), upon being released, also tends to the open position by simple gravity. column12: Safety device for transport systems
column13: A safety device is provided for transport systems such as walkways and stairs that include moving elements ( 1, 2 ) with longitudinal movements and in which one of the moving elements ( 1, 2 ) may undergo tilting movements in relation to an operating direction. A safety counter-guide ( 7 ) is arranged on the moving elements ( 1, 2 ) and prevents the upward tilting of the moving elements ( 1, 2 ). The safety counter-guide also includes a lower sensor ( 8 ) in the form of a band that generates a stop signal for the system upon coming into contact with moving elements ( 1, 2 ). Since the moving elements ( 1, 2 ) cannot tilt in an upwards direction, possible risks both for the user and for the mechanical system are prevented.

column12: Transport system for the movement of passengers/goods
column13: The invention relates to a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by a moving endless belt having: a series of pallet assemblies (100,101); drive equipment (300,320,321,310,311) for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment (400) to the pallet belt (100,101) in a low speed section located in an embarking/disembarking area of the endless belt; drive equipment (300',310',311') for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment (400') to the pallet belt (100,101) in a high speed section located in a middle area of the endless belt; drive equipment (300 '') for transmitting a drive movement from actuation equipment (400 '') to the pallet belt (100,101) in a transitional speed section located between the embarking/disembarking area and the middle areaof the endless belt.

column12: Junta longitudinal
column13: Una junta longitudinal del tipo que forma una superficie utilizable como paso entre una primera superficie de paso (2) y una segunda superficie de paso (3) adyacentes una a la otra, y utilizable como paso de un usuario que camina, siendo variable la distancia entre ambas superficies (2, 3) en la dirección longitudinal , en la que la citada junta longitudinal (1) - comprende una pluralidad de láminas transversales (4) unidas unas a las otras, que tienen una superfi- cie superior sustancialmente plana (5), - en el que cada una de los citados listones transversales (4) está unido a los listones transversales con- tiguos (4) mediante un punto de pivote (6) con respecto al cual los citados listones transversales (4) pueden rotar, manteniendo la continuidad de la superficie de la junta longitudinal (1), - en el que la primera superficie de paso (2) comprende una superficie inferior inclinada (16) en su ex- tremo, quedando oculto un cierto número de listones transversales (4) bajo la citada primera superficie de paso (2), por debajo del nivel de la superficie superior (5) de la junta longitudinal (1), mediante la ro- tación relativa de los listones (4) de unos con los otros respecto al punto de pivote (6), en función de la distancia existente entre la citada primera superficie de paso (2) y la segunda superficie de paso (3), caracterizada porque - la junta longitudinal comprende además una primera superficie intermedia (10) unida a la primera su- perficie de paso (2), y una segunda superficie intermedia (13) unida a la segunda superficie de paso (3), configuradas para soportar los listones transversales (4), descansando al menos una parte de la segunda superficie intermedia (13) sobre la primera superficie intermedia (10), siendo variable la zona de soporte entre ambas superficies (13, 10) en función de la distancia entre la primera superficie de paso (2) y la segunda superficie de paso (3), y - porque los listones transversales (4) descansan adicionalmente sobre superficies de soporte curvadas (8) unidas directamente a la primera superficie intermedia (10); en la que la primera superficie interme- dia (10) está unida a la primera superficie de paso (2).

column12: Technologien zum Labeling und Validieren hochauflösender Kartendaten mit Mensch-Maschine-Schnittstelle
column13: Hierin sind Techniken zum Sammeln von Annotationsdaten über eine spielartige Benutzeroberfläche in einem Fahrzeugsteuersystem offenbart. Gemäß einer hierin offenbarten Ausführungsform detektiert das Fahrzeugsteuersystem einen Auslöser zum Initiieren einer Annotationsaufforderung, die mit einem aus einem Bild klassifizierten Objekt assoziiert ist. Das Fahrzeugsteuersystem stellt die Annotationsaufforderung über eine Benutzeroberfläche dar. Das Fahrzeugsteuersystem empfängt eine Benutzereingabe, die eine Rückmeldung eines Benutzers auf die Annotationsaufforderung angibt, über die Benutzeroberfläche und aktualisiert eine mit dem klassifizierten Objekt assoziierte Konfidenzbewertung als eine Funktion einer oder mehrerer mit dem Benutzer assoziierten Metriken.

column12: Technologies for intelligent traffic optimization with high-definition maps
column13: Technologies for intelligent traffic optimization include a directional flow server that receives dynamic traffic data from traffic infrastructure devices in a monitored region. The traffic data may include traffic volume data and traffic control status data. The server updates a dynamic layer of a high-definition map based on the dynamic traffic data. The high-definition map also includes a static layer and a directional flow layer. The server optimizes the directional flow in response to updating the dynamic layer. The directional flow layer is indicative of traffic direction associated with roads in the monitored region. The server may optimize each of several sub-regions and then optimize connection roads between the regions. The server may distribute the optimized directional flow layer to consumers such as traffic control devices, autonomous vehicles, and other subscribing devices. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

column12: SISTEMA PARA GENERAR AIRE COMPRIMIDO Y PROCEDIMIENTO PARA GESTIONAR GENERACION DE AIRE COMPRIMIDO EN UN AUTOMOVIL.
column13: Sistema para generar aire comprimido en un automóvil que tiene un conversor de energía (4), un compresor secundario (2) y un calderín (1). El conversor de energía (4) tiene un eje de entrada (21) conectado a un elemento de un sistema de suspensión (20) y un eje de salida (22). El conversor de energía (4) transforma un movimiento oscilatorio del elemento del sistema de suspensión (20) en un movimiento rotativo en un solo sentido en el eje de salida (22). El compresor secundario (2) accionado por el eje de salida (22) comprime aire proveniente de una entrada de aire atmosférico (18) y obtiene aire comprimido en una salida de aire comprimido (19). El calderín (1) almacena aire comprimido proveniente de la salida de aire comprimido (19) del compresor secundario (2).

column12: TOOL FOR CLEANING AND DRYING PAINT ROLLERS BY MEANS OF WATER
column13: The invention relates to a tool for cleaning and drying paint rollers, which is formed by a tank with a cover, into which a roller impregnated with paint is placed, the tank containing a tube with nozzles that project water and which is previously inserted into a water inlet by means of a rapid connection, thereby rotating the roller and removing the paint. Once the roller is clean, the water supply is stopped and the roller continues to rotate until the water is removed and the roller is dry. The tool is mainly characterised in that all rollers existing on the market, regardless of height or diameter, can be washed.

column12: System for generating compressed air and method for managing the generation of compressed air in an automobile
column13: The present invention relates to a system for generating compressed air in an automobile having an energy converter (4), a secondary compressor (2) and a tank (1). The energy converter (4) has an inlet shaft (21) connected to an element of a suspension system (20) and an outlet shaft (22). The energy converter (4) converts an oscillating movement of the element of the suspension system (20) into a rotational movement in one single direction in the outlet shaft (22). The secondary compressor (2) driven by the outlet shaft (22) compresses air from an atmospheric air inlet (18) and obtains compressed air in a compressed air outlet (19). The tank (1) stores compressed air from the compressed air outlet (19) of the secondary compressor (2).
column15: FERNANDEZ GONZALEZ JOSE LUIS;;VARGAS GOMEZ DOMINGO;;MEDINA AMEZCUA FRANCISCO MIGUEL

column12: Technologies for labeling and validating human-machine interface high definition-map data
column13: Techniques are disclosed herein for collecting annotation data via a gamified user interface in a vehicle control system. According to an embodiment disclosed herein, the vehicle control system detects a trigger to initiate an annotation prompt associated with an object classified from an image. The vehicle control system presents, via a user interface, the annotation prompt. The vehicle control system receives, via the user interface, user input indicative of a response to the annotation prompt by a user and updates a confidence score associated with the classified object as a function of one or more metrics associated with the user.

column12: METHODS FOR THE TREATMENT OF CARDIAC DISEASE ASSOCIATED TO MYOCARDIAL FIBROSIS USING AN INHIBITOR OF PCP
column13: The invention relates to methods for the treatment of cardiac diseases associated with fibrosis, in particular, chronic cardiac failure or hypertensive heart disease by the use of compounds which are capable of decreasing the activity of the Procollagen C-Proteinase or PCP. The invention also relates to methods for the developing a personalized therapy for the treatment of a patient suffering from a cardiac disease associated to myocardial fibrosis comprising determine in a sample from said patient a parameter indicative of the PCP activity and if the value of said parameter is higher than a predefined threshold value, then the patient is candidate to the treatment with a therapeutically effective amount of a PCP inhibitory agent, in particular, with torasemide.

column12: Linearly actuated rotating handrail system for escalators and moving walkways
column13: LINEARLY ACTUATED ROTATING HANDRAIL SYSTEM FOR ESCALATORS AND MOVING WALKWAYS, which comprises a handrail (8), with first friction means on one side, dragging means comprised of second friction means, configured for coupling to the first in such a way as to drag said band (8) in the displacement direction (D), and pressure means comprised of a first layer of kinematic support, formed by a crank (1), an articulated shaft (3), a driving connection rod (4), shafts (5) and driven cranks (6), and a second layer of friction means formed by traction rollers (7). The application of pressure to the worm band or handrail (8) and its balanced distribution over the different pressure rollers (2) is carried out by means of slides (11) actuated by a distributor (10) which is tightened by an elastic system (12) that transmits the tension by means of a beam (9).

column12: Bidirectional moving walkway
column13: The present invention relates to a bidirectional moving walkway with a tightening system for tightening the band of pallets of the walkway, comprising two tightening units (6, 6') arranged at each end of the moving walkway and each comprising a locking system for locking the movable frame (7) of each end tightening unit (6, 6'), and two drive units (3, 3') each arranged at either end of the moving walkway, the locking system of each tightening unit (6, 6') of either end of the walkway being configured for locking the operation of the tightening unit (6, 6') when the drive unit (3, 3') of its same end is operated, such that the moving walkway always works with the tightening unit operated by the passenger entrance end and locked by the passenger exit end.

column12: Safety device for moving handrails
column13: The invention relates to improvements introduced in invention patent number 200602335 relating to a safety system for moving handrails comprising a plurality of moving handgrips (1), the system having a retractable stop (5) inside the railing (3), a support structure (7), joined to the railing (3), having a guide (9), a lowerable body (11) with respect to the structure (7) and having a guiding rod (12) with a runner (13) and a roller (14) moving parallel to the handgrips (1) and a driving element (15) of the body (11), one of the ends (15b) of which is rotatably connected to the support structure (7) and the other end (15a) is rotatably connected to the lowerable body (11), such that when the retractable stop (5) is pushed by the hand of the user, the rod (12) is moved and the runner (13) is released from the guide (9), the lowerable body (11) being lowered due to the effect of the driving element (15).

column12: Uso de un sensor potenciometrico para medicion en linea de la variable de ph en pulpas de minerales alcalinas, compuesto por electrodo o sensor de bismuto metalico macizo y una referencia electroquimica, que se utiliza en la medicion de ph en pulpas de minerales alcalinos con ph>11.
column13: SENSOR POTENCIORNÉTRICO PARA MEDICIÓN EN LÍNEA DE LAS VARIABLES PH Y POTENCIAL REDOX, EN PULPAS DE MINERALES ALCALINAS CON MEDIOS ALCALINOS CON PH > 11, QUE ESTÁ COMPUESTO POR: A) UN ELECTRODO O SENSOR (1) DE BISMUTO METÁLICO (BI°) MACIZO, PARA MEDIR PH INSERTO EN UN CUERPO; Y B) UNA REFERENCIA ELECTROQUÍMICA Y USO DE DICHO ELECTRODO O SENSOR, EN DONDE EL ELECTRODO O SENSOR (1) ES DE FORMA CILINDRICA Y EN DONDE LA REFERENCIA ELECTROQUIMICA ES DE PLATA/CLORURO DE PLATA (AG/AGCI) O CALOMEL SATURADO (HG/HG2CL2) Y SU USO.

column12: SAFETY DEVICE FOR MOVING HANDRAIL
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To prevent a hand of a user from getting stuck in a portion where a handrail is hidden and where the handrail is returned to a start point of the stairs or a walkway while hiding the handrail, at the end of the moving walkway.

SOLUTION: This device comprises: a retractable stop 5 inside of a railing; a support structure 7 joined to the railing and having a guide 9; a lowerable body 11 with respect to the structure 7 and having a guiding rod 12 with a runner 13 and a roller 14 moving parallel to handgrips; and a driving element 15 of the body 11. One end 15b of the driving element is rotatably connected to the support structure 7, and the other end 15a is rotatably connected to the lowerable body 11, such that, when the retractable stop 5 is pushed by the hand of the user, the rod 12 is moved and the runner 13 is released from the guide 9, and the lowerable body 11 being lower due to the effect of the driving element 15.

column12: Drive system for moving walkways and escalators
column13: The invention relates to a drive system for moving walkways and stairs by means of horizontal drive chains (1), having a drive actuation mechanism and drive chains (1) responsible for causing the movement of the plates (6) of the walkway or steps of the stairs. The drive chains (1) and the plates (6) or steps have direct mutual engagement devices which are opposite and coupled to one another along a straight section of the path of the belt or stairs. The devices have deformable rollers (5) which are assembled in the links of the drive chain (1) and engage in complementary cavities (13) that the plates (6) or steps have at the back part.

column12: Sistema de accionamiento de pasillos y escaleras móviles
column13: Sistema de accionamiento de pasillos y escaleras móviles mediante cadenas de arrastre horizontales (1), quecomprende un mecanismo motriz de accionamiento y cadenas de arrastre encargadas de provocar eldesplazamiento de las placas (6) del pasillo móvil o peldaños de la escalera, donde las cadenas de arrastre (1) y laspaletas (6) o peldaños disponen de medios de engrane mutuo directo, que quedan enfrentados y se acoplan entre sí a lo largo de al menos un tramo recto del trayecto de la cinta o escalera, caracterizado por que dichos medios deengrane consisten en rodillos deformables (5-5'-5'') que van montados en los eslabones (11) de la cadena dearrastre (1) y engranan en cavidades complementarias (13) que presentan las placas (6) o escalones en el reverso;discurriendo los rodillos (5-5'-5'') de la cadena de arrastre (1) en posición enfrentada a las cavidades (13) de laspaletas (6) o peldaños, a lo largo del tramo recto citado del trayecto de la cinta o cadena o escaleras, y penetrando dichas cavidades (13) para definir los medios de engrane entre cadena de arrastre (1) y cinta o escalera, donde losrodillos (5-5'-5'') de las cadenas de arrastre (1) son retractiles en una dirección vertical entre una posición extraída,en la cual engranan en las cavidades (13) de las placas (6) o peldaños, a lo largo del tramo recto citado de latrayectoria de la cinta o escalera, y una posición retraída en la cual quedan separados de las placas (6) o peldaños yno engranan con dichas cavidades (13), estando soportados dichos rodillos (5-5'-5'') en una guía (17) definiendo una leva que los empuja desde la posición retraída a la posición extraída a lo largo del tramo en el que deben engranarcon las placas (6) del pasillo móvil, o peldaños de las escaleras mecánicas.

column12: Transport system for the movement of passengers/goods
column13: The invention relates to a transport system for the movement of passengers/goods formed by a moving endless belt having: a series of pallet assemblies (100, 101) drive equipment (300, 320, 321, 310, 311) for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment (400) to the pallet belt (100, 101) in a low speed section located in an embarking/disembarking area of the endless belt drive equipment (300', 310', 311') for transmitting a drive movement from actuating equipment (400') to the pallet belt (100, 101) in a high speed section located in a middle area of the endless belt drive equipment (300") for transmitting a drive movement from actuation equipment (400") to the pallet belt (100, 101) in a transitional speed section located between the embarking/disembarking area and the middle area of the endless belt.

column12: BIDIRECTIONAL MOVING WALKWAY
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a bidirectional moving walkway with a stretching system improved in the concept.SOLUTION: The bidirectional moving walkway includes: two drive units arranged at both ends of the bidirectional moving walkway, respectively; and stretching units 6 each having a locking system for locking a movable frame 7. The locking system of the stretching unit 6 is designed so that the operation of the stretching unit 6 may be locked when the drive unit is operated, and positioned at the same end as the positioned end of the stretching unit 6. As a result, the bidirectional moving walkway is always operated in such a state that the stretching unit arranged at the passenger entrance end is operated and the stretching unit arranged at the passenger exit end is locked.

column12: PASSAGEM MÓVEL BIDIRECIONAL
column13: PASSAGEM MÓVEL BIDIRECIONAL. A presente invenção se refere a uma passagem móvel bidirecional com um sistema de esticamento para esticar a cinta de paletes da passagem, compreendendo duas unidades de esticamento (6, 6') dispostas em cada extremidade da passagem móvel e cada uma compreendendo um sistema de travamento para travar a armação móvel (7) de cada unidade de esticamento de extremidade (6, 6'), e duas unidades de acionamento (3, 3') cada uma disposta em qualquer extremidade da passagem móvel, o sistema de travamento de cada unidade de esticamento (6, 6') de qualquer extremidade da passagem sendo configurado para travar a operação da unidade de esticamento (6, 6') quando a unidade de acionamento (3, 3') de sua mesma extremidade é operada, de modo que a passagem móvel sempre funciona com a unidade de esticamento operada pela extremidade de entrada de passageiros e travada pela extremidade de saída de passageiros.
column15: ALEMANY MIGUEL ANGEL GONZALEZ;;GARCIA ALBERTO PELLO;;PATINGA JUAN DOMINGO GONZALEZ;;FERVIENZA ALBERTO CANCIO;;CASTRO ALBERTO FLOREZ

column12: Drive system for moving walkways and stairs
column13: The invention relates to a drive system for moving walkways and stairs by means of horizontal drive chains, having a drive actuation mechanism and drive chains responsible for causing the movement of the plates of the walkway or steps of the stairs. The drive chains and the plates or steps have direct mutual engagement devices which are opposite and coupled to one another along a straight section of the path of the belt or stairs. The devices have deformable rollers which are assembled in the links of the drive chain and engage in complementary cavities that the plates or steps have at the back part.

column12: Self-supporting guiding system for moving walkways
column13: The invention relates to a system having: a first longitudinal member and a second longitudinal member arranged symmetrical to the first longitudinal member in relation to a longitudinal mid-plane of the conveyor system, to define a forward movement track and a return track of the rollers ( 4 ); a connecting crossbeam ( 6 ) for connecting the longitudinal members. The longitudinal members have: an upper surface defining the forward movement track ( 2 ) on which the rollers ( 4 ) roll; a lower surface defining the return track ( 3 ) on which the rollers ( 4 ) roll; an inner surface provided with means for fixing the longitudinal members; an outer surface. The first longitudinal member is connected to the second longitudinal member by means of a connecting crossbeam ( 6 ) to ensure a necessary tolerance between longitudinal members.

column12: LINEARLY ACTUATED ROTATING HANDRAIL SYSTEM FOR ESCALATORS AND MOVING WALKWAYS
column13: The present invention is a linearly actuated rotating handrail system for escalators and moving walkways. The system includes a worm band or a handrail, having a first friction device on one side, a dragging device formed by a second friction device and coupled to the first friction device to drag the worm band in the displacement direction. The pressure device includes a first layer of kinematic support, formed by a crank, an articulated shaft, a driving connection rod, shafts and driven cranks. There is a second layer formed by traction rollers. The application of pressure to the worm band or handrail and its balanced distribution over the different pressure rollers is carried out by slides actuated by a distributor, tightened by an elastic system. The elastic system transmits the tension by a beam.

column12: Self-supporting guiding system for moving walkways
column13: The invention relates to a self-supporting guiding system for moving walkways. The invention relates to a system having: a first longitudinal member and a second longitudinal member arranged symmetrical to the first longitudinal member in relation to a longitudinal mid-plane of the conveyor system, to define a forward movement track and a return track of the rollers (4); a connecting crossbeam (6) for connecting the longitudinal members. The longitudinal members have: an upper surface defining the forward movement track (2) on which the rollers (4) roll; a lower surface defining the return track (3) on which the rollers (4) roll; an inner surface provided with means for fixing the longitudinal members; an outer surface. The first longitudinal member is connected to the second longitudinal member by means of a connecting crossbeam (6) to ensure a necessary tolerance between longitudinal members.
column15: ANGEL GONZALEZ ALEMANY MIGUEL;;DOMINGO GONZALEZ PANTIGA JUAN;;MANUEL ALONSO CUELLO;;JOSE OJEDA ARENAS;;MONICA DIAZ SORRIBAS

column12: Drive system for moving walkways and stairs
column13: The invention relates to a drive system for moving walkways and stairs by means of horizontal drive chains, having a drive actuation mechanism and drive chains responsible for causing the movement of the plates of the walkway or steps of the stairs. The drive chains and the pallets or steps have direct mutual engagement devices which are opposite and coupled to one another along a straight section of the path of the belt or stairs. The devices have deformable rollers which are assembled in the links of the drive chain and engage in complementary cavities that the plates or links have at the back part.
